intro: Aegiphila narinensis, commonly known as the Narin's aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of purple or pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
